Jenazah Afridza Munandar Segera Dipulangkan ke Indonesia
03 Nov 2019, 05:00 by Antara, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Jenazah pembalap muda Indonesia, Afridza Munandar, 20 tahun, yang meninggal saat berlaga balap motor Asia Talent Cup di Sepang International Circuit, Sabtu, segera dipulangkan dari Institut Perubatan Forensik Negara Hospital Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
Kepala Satgas Perlindungan WNI KBRI Kuala Lumpur Yusron B Ambary sempat menengok di rumah sakit bersama Tim Asia Talent Cup (ATC) Indonesia atau Idemitsu Honda Indonesia Charlie dan Dandy, Harvey dari Dorna Sports (penyelenggara), para pembalap dan para teknisi dari ATC Indonesia.
"Kami sudah melihat jenazah bersama rekan almarhum. Menurut kepolisian Malaysia besok pagi pukul 08.30 akan dilaksanakan post mortem terhadap jenazah setelah itu dikirim ke Indonesia. Saya sudah menyampaikan prosedurnya dan informasi kasket-kasket (peti jenazah) untuk pengiriman jenazah," katanya Sabtu 2 November 2019.
Yusron mengatakan Keluarga Besar KBRI Kuala Lumpur turut berduka atas wafatnya Afridza Munandar. "Semoga Almarhum husnul khotimah serta keluarga yg ditinggalkan diberikan kesabaran dan ketabahan," katanya.
Dorna sudah menghubungi pihak asuransi yang akan menunjuk perusahaan yang akan mengurus pengiriman jenazah ke Indonesia.
Sementara itu Dorna Sports dalam pernyataannya mengatakan menyusul insiden dalam perlombaan Idemitsu Asia Talent Cup di Sirkuit Internasional Sepang, Sabtu, pihaknya dengan berat hati melaporkan kepergian Afridza Munandar.
Insiden itu terjadi di belokan 10 di Lap 1. Pebalap berusia 20 tahun itu pertama kali menerima perawatan medis di sisi lintasan sebelum dipindahkan ke Rumah Sakit Kuala Lumpur dengan helikopter. Terlepas dari upaya terbaik dari staf medis wilayah dan orang-orang di rumah sakit, Munandar menyerah akibat luka-lukanya.
Munandar adalah pembalap yang menonjol di musim 2019 IATC, meraih dua kemenangan, dua tempat kedua dan dua finis di tempat ketiga dalam satu musim yang membuatnya siap bertarung untuk kejuaraan akhir pekan ini.

text:
Afridza Munandar's body will soon be repatriated to Indonesia
03 Nov 2019, 05:00 by Antara, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The body of a young Indonesian racer, Afridza Munandar, 20, who died while competing in the Asia Talent Cup motor racing at the Sepang International Circuit on Saturday, was immediately repatriated from the State Forensic Hospital Institute of Kuala Lumpur Hospital, Malaysia.
Head of the Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur WNI Protection Task Force Yusron B Ambary had a chance to visit the hospital with the Indonesia Asia Talent Cup (ATC) Team or Idemitsu Honda Indonesia Charlie and Dandy, Harvey from Dorna Sports (organizer), the drivers and technicians from ATC Indonesia.
"We have seen the body with a deceased colleague. According to Malaysian police tomorrow morning at 08.30 a post mortem will be carried out on the body after it is sent to Indonesia. I have submitted the procedure and information on the caskets (casket) for the delivery of the bodies," he said Saturday 2 November. 2019.
Yusron said that the Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur's extended family also mourned the death of Afridza Munandar. "May the late Husnul Khotimah and the family left behind be given patience and fortitude," he said.
Dorna has contacted the insurance company which will appoint a company that will take care of sending bodies to Indonesia.
Meanwhile Dorna Sports said in a statement following the incident at the Idemitsu Asia Talent Cup race at the Sepang International Circuit on Saturday, it reluctantly reported the departure of Afridza Munandar.
The incident took place at Turn 10 on Lap 1. The 20-year-old rider first received medical treatment on the side of the track before being transferred to the Kuala Lumpur Hospital by helicopter. Despite the best efforts of the regional medical staff and people in the hospital, Munandar gave up due to his injuries.
Munandar was a prominent driver in the 2019 IATC season, winning two wins, two second places and two finishing in third place in a season that made him ready to fight for the championship this weekend.
